original.title: Inventei trilha KYC one-click que reduziu onboarding Next de 32 para 6 horas
original.title_pt: Inventei trilha KYC one-click que reduziu onboarding Next de 32 para 6 horas
original.title_en: Invented one-click KYC stream that cut Next onboarding from 32 to 6 hours

pt.s:
"Mandei o mesmo documento cinco vezes. Onde ele está?" O email de cliente beta sintetizava o problema brutal do relançamento Next em 2021: 41% das contas piloto ficavam presas em compliance por 32 horas, 18% desistiam antes da primeira transação, e NPS de onboarding despencou de 56 para 22. Stakes: BACEN abriu 2 ofícios cobrando aderência a novas regras de suitabilidade, 25 clientes beta relatando mesma frustração em grupos focais, e lançamento oficial em risco. Desafio: inventar solução que simplificasse 47 regras BACEN sem comprometer segurança regulatória ou gerar um único incidente.

O relancamento do Next em 2021 ameaçava derrapar porque 41% das contas piloto ficavam presas em compliance por 32 horas e 18% desistiam antes da primeira transacao. O NPS de onboarding despencou de 56 para 22 e o Bacen tinha aberto dois oficios cobrando aderencia a novas regras de suitabilidade. Eu participei de grupos focais com 25 clientes beta e ouvi, de cada um, que o atrito era mandar o mesmo documento cinco vezes e esperar retorno sem prazo.
pt.t: Eu me coloquei como owner unico da esteira KYC/AML e prometi ao CEO reduzir o tempo total para menos de 6 horas, mantendo 0 incidentes regulatorios e aprovando 90% das contas sem intervenção manual. Eu analisei as 47 regras Bacen em detalhe: 12 eram sobre validacao CPF/CNPJ (incluindo consulta obitos), 8 sobre comprovacao renda (contra-cheques, declaracao IR, bureau 3 fontes), 11 sobre suitability financeira (perfil investidor, scoring risco), 9 sobre PEP e lista sancoes internacionais, e 7 sobre documentacao endereco (conta luz, IPTU, contrato aluguel). Percebi que 63% dessas validacoes eram redundantes ou podiam ser automatizadas via APIs (Serasa, Open Banking, gov.br). Eu me comprometi com clientes: enviaria e-mails em meu nome explicando em quanto tempo eles receberiam a resposta.
pt.a: Primeiro, eu inventei o "KYC One-Click": mapeei as 47 regras do Bacen, agrupei em 5 macros (validacao identidade, comprovacao renda, suitability, PEP/sancoes, documentacao endereco) e criei arvores de decisao automatizadas que eu mesmo codifiquei em Python. Para garantir customer obsession, eu repliquei o fluxo na frente dos clientes em usability labs (3 sessoes com 8 clientes cada, 40 horas observacao) e removi 11 telas que clientes chamavam de "tortura". Segundo, eu negociei com compliance para integrar bases externas (Serasa, Open Banking, gov.br) via APIs, assumindo risco pessoal e reputacional ao assinar o termo de responsabilidade por acesso a dados sensíveis — eu me comprometi em reuniao com CTO e CCO que, se houvesse vazamento ou incidente Bacen, eu responderia pessoalmente perante regulador e clientes. Eu também defendi publicamente a decisao em forum executivo mostrando 87 emails de clientes beta chorando de frustracao com o processo antigo, e prometi que se o novo fluxo falhasse, eu reverteria em 24h sem culpar ninguem da equipe. Terceiro, eu criei um mecanismo de prova negativa: caso o documento nao passasse na primeira vez, eu prometia retorno em 90 minutos com orientacao personalizada que eu mesmo revisava (primeiros 500 casos, depois escalei para time com playbook meu). O conflito maior veio do jurídico que queria manter checklist manual; eu provei com dados que 63% dos bloqueios eram falsos positivos de endereco e aceitei pilotar com 50 mil contas sob minha supervisao, assinando compromisso que revisaria amostra 5% diariamente nos primeiros 30 dias. Tambem ajuste o scoring de risco redefinindo pesos para renda variavel e carteira PJ, reduzindo reanalise em 74%.
pt.r: Em 90 dias o tempo de onboarding caiu de 32 horas para 5h58 (-81%), o abandono despencou de 18% para 4% (-78%), e o NPS voltou para 68 (+46 pontos vs. minimo 22, +109% recovery). A taxa de fraude permaneceu em 0,04% (abaixo do benchmark mercado 0,12%) e zeramos oficios do Bacen (antes 2 oficios abertos). O Next bateu 2,1M de contas ativas em cinco meses, adicionando R$ 1,3B em saldos e aumentando receita transacional em R$ 28M no semestre (+34% vs. trimestre anterior). Long-term (18 meses pos-lancamento): NPS onboarding manteve-se em 66-70 (estabilidade 97%), tempo medio onboarding permaneceu 5h30-6h15 (sem regressao), e o mecanismo KYC One-Click foi replicado para onboarding de sellers do ecossistema Elo/Cielo (450 mil sellers onboarded, tempo 48h→8h, NPS seller +28 pontos). Compliance Bacen: zero multas, zero oficios adicionais, e recebemos mencao positiva em relatorio supervisao 2022 sobre "inovacao responsavel em onboarding digital".
pt.l: Aprendi que simplificar compliance exige assumir o discurso com o regulador e com o cliente ao mesmo tempo — quando eu explico exatamente como a regra funciona e dou previsibilidade, o atrito some e a confianca aumenta. Criei framework "Simplify Compliance" com 4 principios que aplico sempre: (1) Medir dor user objetivamente (tempo, abandono, NPS) antes de propor solucao tecnica; (2) Challenge status quo com evidencia de falsos positivos (63% endereco) e business case claro (reanalise -74%, revenue +R$28M); (3) Assumir risco ownership pessoal e publico (assinar termos, prometer ao CEO, defender em forum executivo, revisar amostra 5% diariamente) para ganhar confianca de compliance e jurídico; (4) Replicar mecanismo com playbook documentado (KYC One-Click virou template sellers, billers, e Open Finance). Hoje aplico esse framework em onboarding de sellers e processadores de pagamento: poucos passos (5 macros vs. 47 regras), prometo resposta em horas (SLA 8h com gatilho pausa), mantenho logs auditaveis desde o primeiro clique (trilha assinada digitalmente), e me coloco como single point of contact com regulador (reunioes mensais Bacen levando evidencias). O maior insight: compliance nao e inimigo de customer obsession — e aliado quando voce assume ownership e prova que simplificacao reduz risco real (fraude mantida 0,04%, zero multas 18 meses).

en.s:
"I uploaded the same document five times. Where is it?" A beta customer's email synthesized the brutal problem of Next's 2021 relaunch: 41% of pilot accounts stuck in compliance for 32 hours, 18% abandoned before first transaction, and onboarding NPS plunged from 56 to 22. Stakes: Central Bank issued 2 letters demanding adherence to new suitability rules, 25 beta customers reporting same frustration in focus groups, and official launch at risk. Challenge: invent solution that simplified 47 Central Bank rules without compromising regulatory security or generating a single incident.

The 2021 relaunch of Next was at risk because 41% of pilot accounts were stuck in compliance for 32 hours and 18% abandoned before their first transaction. Onboarding NPS plunged from 56 to 22 and the Central Bank issued two letters demanding adherence to new suitability rules. I joined focus groups with 25 beta customers and heard from every single one that the pain was uploading the same document five times and waiting indefinitely.
en.t: I positioned myself as the single owner of the KYC/AML stream and promised the CEO to cut total time below six hours while keeping zero regulatory incidents and approving 90% of accounts with no manual touch. I analyzed the 47 Central Bank rules in detail: 12 were about CPF/CNPJ validation (including death registry checks), 8 about income proof (pay stubs, tax returns, bureau from 3 sources), 11 about financial suitability (investor profile, risk scoring), 9 about PEP and international sanctions lists, and 7 about address documentation (utility bills, property tax, rental contracts). I realized 63% of these validations were redundant or could be automated via APIs (credit bureau, Open Banking, gov.br). I also committed to customers: I sent emails under my name explaining exactly when they would receive an answer.
en.a: First, I invented the "KYC One-Click": I mapped all 47 Central Bank rules, grouped them into five macros (identity validation, income proof, suitability, PEP/sanctions, address documentation), and built decision trees that I coded in Python. To guarantee customer obsession I replicated the flow in front of customers during usability labs (3 sessions with 8 customers each, 40 hours observation) and removed 11 screens customers called "torture". Second, I negotiated with compliance to integrate external data sets (credit bureau, Open Banking, gov.br) through APIs, taking personal and reputational risk by signing the liability letter for access to sensitive data — I committed in a meeting with CTO and CCO that if there was a leak or Central Bank incident, I would personally answer to regulators and customers. I also publicly defended the decision in an executive forum showing 87 emails from beta customers crying in frustration with the old process, and promised that if the new flow failed, I would revert it in 24h without blaming anyone on the team. Third, I created a negative-proof mechanism: if a document failed, I promised a 90-minute turnaround with personalized guidance that I reviewed myself (first 500 cases, then scaled to team with my playbook). The toughest conflict came from Legal who wanted to keep manual checklists; I proved 63% of blocks were address false positives and agreed to pilot with 50 thousand accounts under my supervision, signing a commitment to review 5% sample daily for the first 30 days. I also tuned the risk scoring by redefining weights for variable income and business accounts, cutting reanalysis by 74%.
en.r: Within 90 days onboarding time fell from 32 hours to 5h58 (-81%), abandonment dropped from 18% to 4% (-78%), and NPS climbed back to 68 (+46 points vs. low of 22, +109% recovery). Fraud stayed at 0.04% (below market benchmark 0.12%) and Central Bank letters went to zero (previously 2 open letters). Next reached 2.1M active accounts in five months, added R$ 1.3B in balances, and increased transactional revenue by R$ 28M in the semester (+34% vs. prior quarter). Long-term (18 months post-launch): onboarding NPS held at 66-70 (97% stability), average onboarding time remained 5h30-6h15 (no regression), and the KYC One-Click mechanism was replicated for seller onboarding in the Elo/Cielo ecosystem (450 thousand sellers onboarded, time 48h→8h, seller NPS +28 points). Central Bank compliance: zero fines, zero additional letters, and we received positive mention in the 2022 supervision report about "responsible innovation in digital onboarding".
en.l: I learned that simplifying compliance means owning the conversation with regulators and customers at the same time — when I clarify how the rule works and provide predictability, friction disappears and trust increases. I created the "Simplify Compliance" framework with 4 principles I always apply: (1) Measure user pain objectively (time, abandonment, NPS) before proposing technical solution; (2) Challenge status quo with false positive evidence (63% address) and clear business case (reanalysis -74%, revenue +R$28M); (3) Take personal and public ownership risk (sign terms, promise to CEO, defend in executive forum, review 5% sample daily) to earn compliance and legal trust; (4) Replicate mechanism with documented playbook (KYC One-Click became template for sellers, billers, and Open Finance). Today I apply this framework to seller and payment processor onboarding: few steps (5 macros vs. 47 rules), promise response in hours (8h SLA with pause trigger), maintain auditable logs from first click (digitally signed trail), and position myself as single point of contact with regulator (monthly Central Bank meetings presenting evidence). The biggest insight: compliance is not the enemy of customer obsession — it's an ally when you take ownership and prove simplification reduces real risk (fraud held at 0.04%, zero fines for 18 months).

fups.q: Como voce convenceu compliance a abrir as APIs externas?
fups.a: Eu apresentei business case com reducao de 74% em reanalise e aceitei ser o ponto de contato unico com os provedores, assinando SLA de resposta em 90 minutos.
fups.q_en: How did you convince compliance to open external APIs?
fups.a_en: I presented a business case showing a 74% drop in reanalysis and agreed to be the sole point of contact with providers, signing a 90-minute response SLA.

fups.q: Que sinal de customer obsession voce mais usou?
fups.a: Eu liguei pessoalmente para clientes que abandonavam e prometi retorno cronometrado; os depoimentos direcionaram quais telas eliminar.
fups.q_en: What customer-obsession signal did you rely on the most?
fups.a_en: I personally called customers who abandoned and promised timed callbacks; their feedback guided which screens to remove.

fups.q: Como voce garantiu aderencia regulatoria apos automatizar?
fups.a: Eu criei trilha de auditoria com logs assinados digitalmente e agendei reunioes mensais com Bacen levando evidencias de falso positivo.
fups.q_en: How did you ensure regulatory adherence after automating?
fups.a_en: I built an audit trail with digitally signed logs and held monthly regulator meetings presenting false-positive evidence.

fups.q: Qual trade-off financeiro voce assumiu?
fups.a: Eu reestruturei pricing para cobrir o investimento, cobrando 5 bps extra de clientes que desejavam onboarding imediato.
fups.q_en: What financial trade-off did you assume?
fups.a_en: I restructured pricing to cover the investment, adding 5 bps for customers demanding immediate onboarding.

fups.q: Como voce manteve ratio EU:NOS acima de 3:1?
fups.a: Eu centralizei aprovacoes, escrevi pessoalmente as cartas ao Bacen e registrei todas as decisoes criticas como minhas no comite executivo.
fups.q_en: How did you keep the I:we ratio above 3:1?
fups.a_en: I centralized approvals, personally wrote the letters to the regulator, and documented every critical decision as mine in the executive committee.

fups.q: Quais metricas voce acompanhou apos o go-live?
fups.a: SLA medio, abandono, NPS, fraude, reclamacoes no Bacen e volume de reanalise; eu enviava boletim semanal ao CEO.
fups.q_en: Which metrics did you track after go-live?
fups.a_en: Average SLA, abandonment, NPS, fraud, regulator complaints, and reanalysis volume; I sent a weekly report to the CEO.

fups.q: Como voce tratou clientes de maior risco?
fups.a: Eu criei camada de grafos que detecta relacoes e valida automaticamente cada beneficiario, escalando para analise manual somente acima de score 0,7.
fups.q_en: How did you handle higher-risk customers?
fups.a_en: I built a graph layer detecting relationships and auto-validating beneficiaries, escalating to manual review only when the score exceeded 0.7.

fups.q: Qual foi o maior aprendizado para pagamentos?
fups.a: Aplicar o conceito de one-click KYC para sellers e billers, garantindo experiencia simples e logs completos desde o inicio.
fups.q_en: What was the biggest takeaway for payments?
fups.a_en: Apply the one-click KYC concept to sellers and billers, ensuring simple experience and full logs from day one.

fups.q: Que mecanismos evitam regressao do processo?
fups.a: Eu criei scorecard semanal com gatilho que pausa onboarding se SLA passar de 8 horas e exigi treino trimestral de compliance baseado em dados reais.
fups.q_en: What mechanisms prevent regression?
fups.a_en: I built a weekly scorecard with a trigger suspending onboarding if SLA exceeds eight hours and mandated quarterly compliance training based on real data.

fups.q: Como voce compartilhou os resultados com o cliente final?
fups.a: Enviei e-mail personalizado destacando tempo medio de resposta e video explicando o novo fluxo, encerrando com mic-drop de que o risco ficava comigo.
fups.q_en: How did you share results with the end customer?
fups.a_en: I sent personalized emails highlighting response time and a video explaining the new flow, closing with a mic drop that I was taking the risk.

fups.a_en: I restructured pricing to cover the investment, adding 5 bps for customers demanding immediate onboarding.

fups.q: Como voce manteve ratio EU:NOS acima de 3:1?
fups.a: Eu centralizei aprovacoes, escrevi pessoalmente as cartas ao Bacen e registrei todas as decisoes criticas como minhas no comite executivo.
fups.q_en: How did you keep the I:we ratio above 3:1?
fups.a_en: I centralized approvals, personally wrote the letters to the regulator, and documented every critical decision as mine in the executive committee.

fups.q: Quais metricas voce acompanhou apos o go-live?
fups.a: SLA medio, abandono, NPS, fraude, reclamacoes no Bacen e volume de reanalise; eu enviava boletim semanal ao CEO.
fups.q_en: Which metrics did you track after go-live?
fups.a_en: Average SLA, abandonment, NPS, fraud, regulator complaints, and reanalysis volume; I sent a weekly report to the CEO.

fups.q: Como voce tratou clientes de maior risco?
fups.a: Eu criei camada de grafos que detecta relacoes e valida automaticamente cada beneficiario, escalando para analise manual somente acima de score 0,7.
fups.q_en: How did you handle higher-risk customers?
fups.a_en: I built a graph layer detecting relationships and auto-validating beneficiaries, escalating to manual review only when the score exceeded 0.7.

fups.q: Qual foi o maior aprendizado para pagamentos?
fups.a: Aplicar o conceito de one-click KYC para sellers e billers, garantindo experiencia simples e logs completos desde o inicio.
fups.q_en: What was the biggest takeaway for payments?
fups.a_en: Apply the one-click KYC concept to sellers and billers, ensuring simple experience and full logs from day one.

fups.q: Que mecanismos evitam regressao do processo?
fups.a: Eu criei scorecard semanal com gatilho que pausa onboarding se SLA passar de 8 horas e exigi treino trimestral de compliance baseado em dados reais.
fups.q_en: What mechanisms prevent regression?
fups.a_en: I built a weekly scorecard with a trigger suspending onboarding if SLA exceeds eight hours and mandated quarterly compliance training based on real data.

fups.q: Como voce compartilhou os resultados com o cliente final?
fups.a: Enviei e-mail personalizado destacando tempo medio de resposta e video explicando o novo fluxo, encerrando com mic-drop de que o risco ficava comigo.
fups.q_en: How did you share results with the end customer?
fups.a_en: I sent personalized emails highlighting response time and a video explaining the new flow, closing with a mic drop that I was taking the risk.
